unnormalised: The CBSE class 10 results are finally out! Students can check their scores on cbseresults.nic.in. This year, the overall pass percentage stands at 93.12%, a slight dip from last year's 94.4%.
normalised: The C-B-S-E class ten results are finally out! Students can check their scores on c b s e results dot n i c dot in. This year, the overall pass percentage stands at ninety three point one two percent, a slight dip from last year's ninety four point four percent.

unnormalised: Lots of kids scored above 90%! Apparently, Rohan Sharma from DPS RK Puram bagged 98.6%, topping his school. His marksheet shows 99 in Maths, 98 in Science, 97 in English, 100 in Social Science, and 99 in Hindi. Totaling a whooping 493/500!
normalised: Lots of kids scored above ninety percent! Apparently, Rohan Sharma from D-P-S R-K Puram bagged ninety eight point six percent, topping his school. His marksheet shows ninety nine in Maths, ninety eight in Science, ninety seven in English, one hundred in Social Science, and ninety nine in Hindi. Totaling a whooping four hundred and ninety three divided by five hundred!

unnormalised: Reports coming in from various schools across India suggest a mixed bag. While some schools are celebrating a 100% pass rate, others are focusing on students who need additional support.
normalised: Reports coming in from various schools across India suggest a mixed bag. While some schools are celebrating a one hundred percent pass rate, others are focusing on students who need additional support.

unnormalised: The board has also announced the dates for re-evaluation and compartment exams. Students unhappy with their marks can apply for re-evaluation by 25/07/2024. The compartment exams, for those who didn't clear one or two subjects, will be held in August, from 10/08/2024 to 20/08/2024.
normalised: The board has also announced the dates for re-evaluation and compartment exams. Students unhappy with their marks can apply for re-evaluation by twenty fifth July two thousand and twenty four. The compartment exams, for those who didn't clear one or two subjects, will be held in August, from tenth August two thousand and twenty four to twentieth August two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Parents are advised to stay calm and supportive, irrespective of the outcome. Remember, marks aren't everything! Talent toh aur bhi fields mein ho sakta hai.
normalised: Parents are advised to stay calm and supportive, irrespective of the outcome. Remember, marks aren't everything! Talent toh aur bhi fields mein ho sakta hai.

unnormalised: The pressure on students is immense, especially with the increasing competition. It's crucial to remember that these numbers don't define their potential. There's always a next time to do better, and many other paths to success.
normalised: The pressure on students is immense, especially with the increasing competition. It's crucial to remember that these numbers don't define their potential. There's always a next time to do better, and many other paths to success.

unnormalised: Don't forget, counseling services are also available for students struggling with exam stress. You can call the CBSE helpline at 1800-11-8004 for assistance. Remember, aap akele nahi ho. Sab theek ho jaega.
normalised: Don't forget, counseling services are also available for students struggling with exam stress. You can call the C-B-S-E helpline at one eight hundred hyphen one one hyphen eight zero zero four for assistance. Remember, aap akele nahi ho. Sab theek ho jaega.
